translated: Volume 7 of the Comprehensive Catalog of Scriptures
Compiled by the Sui Dynasty Monk Fa Jing and Others
The Assembly of Monks at the Daxingshan Monastery, including the Monk Fa Jing, respectfully address the Emperor, the Great Dana-giver.
On the tenth day of the fifth month,
the Chamberlain for Ceremonials, Niu Hong, was ordered to compile a catalog of the scriptures.
We respectfully completed the compilation.
A total of 2,257 scriptures are included, with 5,310 fascicles in seven volumes.
The separate catalog has six volumes,
and the general catalog has one volume.
The copying is now complete.
We respectfully present it.
We also respectfully address this.
We humbly consider the unsurpassed Dharma Jewel, whose Way benefits endlessly.
In the middle of the transmission of images, it was first received in this land.
In the past, when Fang Shuo saw ashes in the Kunming Lake,
he was ordered to ask the Western Regions for answers.
Liu Xiang collated the scriptures.
The Tiange Record recorded it.
It was already seen in Buddhist scriptures, and only then did we know that the true Dharma had long arrived during the Former Han Dynasty.
It is not that it began to flow into this land during the Later Han dynasty.
But since the Way is bland and emotions are flowery, the true and false are profoundly separated, and few people respect it.
Even if it exists, it is as if it does not.
Moreover, the reason why Emperor Ming had a dream and saw the golden countenance appear,
It must be that the holy Way relies on the emperor and king.
It is merely the beginning of greatly opening up and revering it.
Thus, he sent envoys to the Western Regions to exclusively seek Buddhist scriptures.
Because of this, Ma Teng and Dharma Lan first translated the Forty-two Chapters.
Shi Hu and Zhi Chen widely translated the other sutra sections.
After that, those who transmitted the Way came one after another.
Even up to the days of Wei and Jin in the capital Luoyang.
Although Zhi Qian and Kang Senghui suddenly proclaimed it in Jinling,
And Zhu Hu and Lan Ju flew to translate in Yong and Luo,
However, reverence and respect were still simple, and the practice was indeed subtle.
By the time of the Eastern Jin and the two Qin dynasties, the sutras and precepts were roughly complete.
But the Dharma relies on people to flourish, and the wise and virtuous are widely known.
Thus, Dharma Master Dao'an first established the catalog of various sutras.
To select and translate the scriptures of the Ming era.
To seek out the missing and incomplete, and compile a complete record.
Since then, for two hundred years.
There have been dozens of people who have compiled scripture catalogs.
Some use numbers to seek, some use names to obtain.
Some rely on the times, some entrust to translators.
Each records a corner, striving to preserve what they have seen.
Only the Vinaya Master Sengyou of Yangzhou.
Compiled the Records of the Tripiá¹­aka, which is quite impressive.
However, it still treats the small and large equally, and mixes the Tripiá¹­aka together.
Copied collections are mixed with authentic scriptures, and the records are confused with the sÅ«tras.
Examining the beginning and end, it cannot encompass everything.
How can the other catalogs be said to be numerous?
Since the monks have not yet been able to see the sÅ«tras of the three countries and examine their differences and similarities.
Now I will only rely on the catalogs of various houses.
Eliminating what is possible and impossible, and listing the main points in total.
Arranged into nine catalogs, distinguishing the categories.
There are forty-two parts, with the first six catalogs having thirty-six parts.
Briefly showing the differences between the sÅ«tras, vinaya, and abhidharma of the Great and Lesser Vehicles.
Roughly clarifying the authenticity and falsehood of the translations.
The latter three sections collect biographies and commentaries.
The first three sections are all composed by sages and worthies of the Western Regions.
Because they are not the true sÅ«tras of the Tripiá¹­aka, they are recorded separately.
The latter three sections are all composed by famous and virtuous people of this land.
Although they are not comparable to those produced in the Western Regions,
they are all commentaries on the true sÅ«tras.
They illuminate the teachings and doctrines,
illuminating the previous traditions.
They open up and advance the study of later generations.
Therefore, they are also included.
Furthermore, Fa Jing and others further think:
Many of the sÅ«tra catalogues of various schools were compiled by the wise and virtuous people of previous generations.
The virtuous people of the past were all called the foremost scholars of their time.
However, the compilations they produced were not very detailed.
It is not that those virtuous people lacked talent or knowledge.
It is simply that the days they encountered
were when the world was in disarray and there was no ruler in the nine prefectures.
Each prefecture and county is called the imperial capital.
The borders and barriers are all considered battlefields.
The places where the scriptures come from are all unknown to each other.
Learners hear of them from afar, but never get to see them in their entire lives.
Therefore, although the sages of the past had talent and ability,
if they did not encounter the right time, they had nothing to expound.
In the present, the understanding and learning of scriptures is truly not as good as in the past.
But due to many fortunate karmic conditions, I have the good fortune of this auspicious time.
The four seas are considered one family, and the six directions are peaceful and prosperous.
Distant and exotic customs are as if right before one's eyes.
The imperial calendar is distributed everywhere, and the written rules have no boundaries.
Moreover, the great donor, the emperor,
although personally managing the myriad affairs,
devotes himself to the Way all day long, restoring the Three Jewels and becoming a Dharma Wheel-Turning King.
Forever closing the door to the four evil destinies,
greatly opening the path to the heavens and humans.
All beings within the realm are grateful for this.
How much more so for scriptures like these.
What need is there to discuss further? I regret that my understanding and wisdom are not extensive, yet I have participated in this auspicious time.
They were unable to obtain the complete scriptures and remaining texts and lost Dharma from the three countries.
When hastily compiling, there were many omissions.
Thinking about it now, I feel deeply ashamed.
Respectfully submitted on the fourteenth day of the seventh month in the fourteenth year of the Kaihuang era by the assembly of Å›ramaá¹‡as such as Faxing of Daxingshan Temple.
